newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU "deeply deplores" Israeli housing decision.
newsitem.headline: EU "deeply deplores" Israeli housing decision.

text.p: The European Union said on Wednesday it deeply deplored Israel's approval of the building of new Jewish housing in Arab East Jerusalem.

"The EU deeply deplores the decision of the Israeli government to approve construction plans for Har Homa/Jabal Abu Ghneim located on the West Bank in the Jerusalem area," a statement issued by the Dutch EU presidency said.
"The EU has repeatedly stated that settlements in the occupied territories contravene international law and are a major obstacle to peace," the statement said.
Earlier on Wednesday Israel approved the building of new Jewish housing in Arab East Jerusalem despite warnings the project could unleash a wave of Palestinian violence.
The homes will be built at Jabal Abu Ghneim, called Har Homa by Israel, a tree-covered hill taken by Israel in the 1967 Middle East war. The site is between Jerusalem and Bethlehem.
